titleStmt.title: Musical works from Pierre Fatio's library (Geneva 1707) (Historical Music Inventories, 16)

publicationStmt.publisher: RISM Digital Center, Université de Fribourg, Switzerland

msContents.summary:
The post mortem inventory of the belongings of Pierre Fatio (1662-1707), a Genevan lawyer and politician who was executed on the accusation of high treason, contains 40 pages of items from his personal library. The manuscript bears the title "Inventaire des biens meubles et effets delaissé par deffunct Pierre Fatio [...]". The entries for the library start with the title: "Chapitre de la bibliotecte dudi[t] deffunct" and these pages are numbered by a recent hand from 1 to 40. On p. 24 there is a sub-heading, "Livres de Musique".
20 entries for music books are written on p. 24 and 25. On p. 26 the next sub-heading follows, "Livre d'histoire". But there are still two music titles on p. 26 and two on p. 27, that were possibly forgotten and added later. The mentioned music sources are thus in total 24. Titles are given for the printed works. Manuscripts are subsumed under a collective title "Pièces de divers autherus ecritte a la main".
The images are taken from the original in the State Archive of Geneva (Archives d'Etat de Genève), AEG Jur. Civ. F 300.
